column4: Has anyone ever had there harddisk fill to 100% by itself?  Stuck in command line now since don't have enough free space to startx.  Waiting for a "du -sk * | sort -rn" to finish.  Open to any tips :)
du says my /media is very large
93G.  Son of a gun.  My home is 31G and it's a 140G drive.   Sounds like the bad guys in media.
Though i thought media was symbolic links to other stuff
it looks like media is full of Backups from simplebackup
oy.  I had simple backup configured to backup to a raid array automatically
but the raid doesn't start automatically in ubuntu for some reason
so it looks like whenever i haven't given ubuntu credentials to assemble root, backups are going in there
how did you build the RAID array?
nice.  For some reason mine show up in computer and when i double click the raid icon, it prompts for admin password
sounds like permissions, before you click on the array in computer, does it show as mounted with a "df -h" at the command line?
will do .  Restarting.  Got down to 92% by removing a backup.  Hopefully can boot to GUI now
no big info in the logs.  There's a mdadm[1812]: NewArray event detected on md device /dev/md0 every now and then
